snippet: Fans and collectors say that as a business and a part of American entertainment, doo-wop seems destined to go the way of Ronnie I’s Clifton Music, which is closing this month.
abstract: Ronnie I's Clifton Music, a record shop in Clifton, NJ, is closing its doors after 40 years; fans and collectors say that the business is another victim of the Internet, the economy, and changing tastes in music, and is a troubling sign that doo-wop music itself is headed for the same fate.
lead_paragraph: Fans and collectors say that as a business and a part of American entertainment, doo-wop seems destined to go the way of Ronnie I’s Clifton Music, which is closing this month.

headline.seo: As Ronnie I’s Closes, Sounds of Doo-Wop Fade Away
headline.main: A Doo-Wop Shop Prepares to Close, Signaling the End of a Fading Genre
headline.print_headline: A Doo-Wop Shop Prepares to Close, Signaling the End Of a Fading Genre
